alert.note: Alert for Hill (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 28 at 5:26PM CDT until April 29 at 3:46PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 600 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN MCLENNAN AND SOUTHEASTERN HILL COUNTIES... At 526 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles east of West, or 15 miles northeast of Lacy-Lakeview, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Hubbard, Leroy, Mount Calm, Ross, Malone, Penelope, Birome, Tours and Pelham. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for central Texas.
